title: How to get a job reading audio books - Quora

response.answer_text: Many nonprofit projects need people to read material for accessibility purposes (that is, so that they can still offer content to blind or visually impaired people). Volunteering for these is one way to build a portfolio. Then, make sure you have a clear and consistent speaking voice.

I don’t know of a job where reading audio books is part of the actual job. I do know of a number of people who drive professionally and listen to audio books in the course of their work day - truck drivers, Uber drivers, cabbies. Like, a lot of audio books - I have heard of one trucker who has gone through Shakespeare’s complete works twice and is working on a third completion. Time well spent, I’d say.
You will need training in voice over and acting along with learning how to record in your home studio. Narrating and producing audiobooks is a small business of which you are the owner.
